This service is to claim tax benefits on: This service is to claim tax benefits online.
Please correct the errors on the page: Please correct the errors on the page
Please enter your RRSP contributions bef: Please enter your RRSP contributions before March 1, 2019.
Welcome to the Canada Revenue Agency’s n: Welcome to the Canada Revenue Agency’s new
You need to be eligible to use this serv: You need to be eligible to use this service.
In order to claim tax benefits online, y: In order to claim tax benefits online, you must have the following:
Your taxes have been filed with the Cana: Your taxes have been filed with the Canada Revenue Agency.
Use this confirmation number if you need: Use this confirmation number if you need to contact CRA for further information or for additional help with your tax return.
Print a summary of your tax return: Print a summary of your tax return
Your Notice of Assessment is an official: Your Notice of Assessment is an official CRA communication that confirms that you’ve filed your taxes. It also contains the details of your refund or balance owing. Please read this document carefully.
Now that your return is filed, you shoul: Now that your return is filed, you should be all set for the year.
However, if you still have further quest: However, if you still have further questions, there are several ways to get help:
Speak to someone at your nearest tax cli: Speak to someone at your nearest tax clinic
find a free tax clinic in your area: find a free tax clinic in your area
Speak to a CRA agent by calling: Speak to a CRA agent by calling
Your personal access code is the the 9-c: Your personal access code is the the 9-character code at the bottom of your notification letter.
Your code is on the personally-addressed: Your code is on the personally-addressed letter.
We just need one more piece of informati: We just need one more piece of information to authenticate you.
Please enter your date of birth in the f: Please enter your date of birth in the field below.
Now that we have your personal code, we: Now that we have your personal code, we need some additional information in order to verify that it’s you.
Please enter your Social Insurance Numbe: Please enter your Social Insurance Number (SIN) in the field below.
Confirm your most recent benefit payment: Confirm your most recent benefit payment
Before we can update your information, w: Before we can update your information, we need to ask a further question to verify your identity.
Please enter the most recent benefit pay: Please enter the most recent benefit payment you received. If it matches our records, you will be able to update your information on the next page.
Enter your most recent benefit payment: Enter your most recent benefit payment
We’ve located your file for the current: We’ve located your file for the current tax year, 2018.
The first step to filing your taxes and: The first step to filing your taxes and getting your benefits is making sure your address and other personal information is up to date.
Please confirm this is still your curren: Please confirm this is still your current name.
If you have changed your name since the: If you have changed your name since the last time you filed your taxes,
get in contact with the CRA to update yo: get in contact with the CRA to update your information
Once updated, you can proceed to use thi: Once updated, you can proceed to use this service.
You can find the marital status we have: You can find the marital status we have on file below. Click confirm if this is correct or change it. Having your accurate marital status on file is important for you to properly file your taxes and get your benefits.
Please choose the correct status from th: Please choose the correct status from the options listed below.
In order to be eligible for this service: In order to be eligible for this service, your primary residence on December 31, 2018, must have been in Ontario.
If you live outside of Ontario, we will: If you live outside of Ontario, we will provide you with alternative options in which you can complete your tax return.
Please review the address details closel: Please review the address details closely to make sure they’re correct. You can change your address to update our records—this is important for making sure you receive your benefits and tax refund (if applicable).
Please enter the correct mailing address: Please enter the correct mailing address information below. If a letter is sent to this address, you must be able to receive it.
Did you contribute to an RRSP?: Did you contribute to an RRSP?
Your taxes can’t be completed using this: Your taxes can’t be completed using this service
Did you make any charitable donations in: Did you make any charitable donations in 2018?
Please enter your charitable donations i: Please enter your charitable donations into the fields below.
Total donations made to registered chari: Total donations made to registered charities
Your tax return is too complex to be fil: Your tax return is too complex to be filed using this service. Nothing about your taxes is incorrect — see below for further instructions on how to complete your tax return.
To finish filing your taxes for 2018, yo: To finish filing your taxes for 2018, you will need to do one of the following:
Use the paper form enclosed in the Claim: Use the paper form enclosed in the Claim Tax Benefits package you received in the mail
If you made RRSP contributions before Ma: If you made RRSP contributions before March 1, 2019, you can deduct them from your total income on your taxes this year.
Symbol of the Government of Canada: Symbol of the Government of Canada
To get the most out of your: To get the most out of your
you can enter the amount you paid in ren: you can enter the amount you paid in rent in the current tax year.
if you paid no rent in 2018 or if you do: if you paid no rent in 2018 or if you don’t have the receipts to verify this information later.
Please enter the total property tax paid: Please enter the total property tax paid for your principal residence in 2018.
if you paid no property tax in 2018 or i: if you paid no property tax in 2018 or if you don’t have the receipts to verify this information later.

Please enter the home energy costs paid: Please enter the home energy costs paid for your principal residence on a reserve in Ontario in 2018.

if this doesn’t apply to you or if you d: if this doesn’t apply to you or if you don’t have the receipts to verify this information later.

Did you live in a designated student res: Did you live in a designated student residence in 2018?
Confirm your province or territory of re: Confirm your province or territory of residence
In order to be eligible for this service: In order to be eligible for this service, your primary residence on December 31, 2018, must have been in Ontario. If you live outside of Ontario, we will provide you with alternative options in which you can complete your tax return.
Did you make any political contributions: Did you make any political contributions in 2018?
Please enter your political contribution: Please enter your political contributions into the fields below.
Here’s what CRA knows about your income: Here’s what CRA knows about your income for the current tax year (filing for 2018). Additional claims and deductions can be made afterwards.

If this information doesn’t match your r: If this information doesn’t match your records, you can’t change it here.
You should not use this service to file: You should not use this service to file income information you believe to be incorrect.
You’re eligible for the Climate Action I: You’re eligible for the Climate Action Incentive, which you will receive automatically.
There is an additional 10% credit for re: There is an additional 10% credit for residents of small and rural communities
Did you live in a small and rural commun: Did you live in a small and rural community in December 2018?
How do I know if I live in a small and r: How do I know if I live in a small and rural community
You live in a small or rural community i: You live in a small or rural community if you
live in these areas: Ottawa, Kingston, B: live in these areas: Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborough, Oshawa, Toronto, Hamilton, St. Catharines-Niagara, Kitchener-Cambridge-Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, London, Windsor, Barrie, Sudbury, or Thunder Bay.
You can claim medical expenses for your: You can claim medical expenses for your self, spouse or common-law partner, and dependent children born after 2001.
Would you like to claim medical expenses: Would you like to claim medical expenses?
Enter the total cost of medical expenses: Enter the total cost of medical expenses for your self, spouse, and dependent children born after 2001
Learn more about eligible medical expens: Learn more about eligible medical expenses
Eligible medical expenses can include sp: Eligible medical expenses can include specialized equipment, accessibility devices, etc. For more information, please refer to
the CRA's guide to eligible medical expe: the CRA's guide to eligible medical expenses
This is an overview of your projected ta: This is an overview of your projected tax return, and all the benefits you will receive when you file for the current tax year.
Take one final look before continuing. I: Take one final look before continuing. If something looks incorrect, please
I confirm that, as far as I know, all th: I confirm that, as far as I know, all the information in this tax return is accurate
You are eligible for this service if:: You are eligible for this service if:
You earned under $35,000 in 2018 (from e: You earned under $35,000 in 2018 (from employment, pension, RRSP withdrawals, or from benefits and credits you received)
You do not have self-employment income t: You do not have self-employment income to report
You do not earn investment income (excep: You do not earn investment income (except for nominal interest income from Canadian sources)

you paid for your main residence (includ: you paid for your main residence (including a private long-term care home) in 2018.

Without your correct name on file, you c: Without your correct name on file, you can’t file your taxes using this online service. You can still file using the Claim Tax Benefits service – follow the instructions on page X of the paper package we mailed to you.
There are also other free and secure way: There are also other free and secure ways to file your taxes:
This service is only available to reside: This service is only available to residents of Ontario
Since you weren’t a resident of Ontario: Since you weren’t a resident of Ontario on December 31, 2018, you can’t use this service to file your taxes.
The income we have on file does not matc: The income we have on file does not match your records
If your records don’t match the income i: If your records don’t match the income information displayed earlier, or you believe it to be incorrect, you shouldn’t use this service to file your taxes.
Keep your notification letter with you. You need information on that letter to use this service.
